Interface_name: HTTP client using cURL in PHP
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements an HTTP client using cURL for making HTTP requests with support for various methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH), custom headers, and request/response logging.

Class Description: The Curl class is an HTTP client implementation that uses PHP's cURL extension to send HTTP requests and handle responses. It supports common HTTP methods, allows configuration of cURL options, handles request headers and parameters, and provides detailed response information including headers, status code, and body.

Attributes:

curlOptions: [array] - Default cURL options including timeout, SSL verification, redirects, etc.
requestArguments: [array] - Stores the current request parameters including URI, method, parameters, and headers.
requestHeader: [array] - Default request headers that can be extended or overridden.
responseBody: [string] - Stores the response body from the last request.
responseHeader: [array] - Stores the response headers from the last request.
responseHttpCode: [int] - Stores the HTTP status code from the last request.
responseClientError: [string|null] - Stores any cURL error from the last request.
responseClientInfo: [array] - Stores cURL info from the last request.
logger: [object|null] - Optional logger instance for request/response logging.

Methods:

request: [request](string $uri, string $method = 'GET', array $parameters = [], array $headers = [], bool $multipart = false) -> string - Makes an HTTP request to the specified URI with given method, parameters and headers. Returns the response body.
getResponse: [getResponse]() -> array - Returns complete request/response information including headers, status code, body, and client info.
setCurlOptions: [setCurlOptions](array $curlOptions) -> void - Sets additional cURL options.
setLogger: [setLogger](object $logger) -> void - Sets a logger instance for request/response logging.
getResponseBody: [getResponseBody]() -> string - Returns the response body from the last request.
getResponseHeader: [getResponseHeader]() -> array - Returns the response headers from the last request.
getResponseHttpCode: [getResponseHttpCode]() -> int - Returns the HTTP status code from the last request.
getResponseClientError: [getResponseClientError]() -> string|null - Returns any cURL error from the last request.
fetchResponseHeader: [fetchResponseHeader](resource $curl, string $header) -> int - Callback function for processing response headers.
prepareRequestHeaders: [prepareRequestHeaders]() -> array - Prepares request headers in cURL format.
getResponseClientInfo: [getResponseClientInfo]() -> array - Returns cURL info from the last request.
getRequestArguments: [getRequestArguments]() -> array - Returns the arguments used for the last request.
